channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: STAR: SQL Guided Pre-Training for Context-dependent Text-to-SQL Parsing
item.description: Concretely, we propose two novel pre-training objectives which respectively explore the context-dependent interactions of NL utterances and SQL queries within each text-to-SQL conversation: (i) schema state tracking (SST) objective that tracks and explores the schema states of context-dependent SQL queries in the form of schema-states by predicting and updating the value of each schema slot during interaction; (ii) utterance dependency tracking (UDT) objective that employs weighted contrastive learning to pull together two semantically similar NL utterances and push away the representations of semantically dissimilar NL utterances within each conversation.

item.title: Optimizing text representations to capture (dis)similarity between political parties
item.description: Even though fine-tuned neural language models have been pivotal in enabling "deep" automatic text analysis, optimizing text representations for specific applications remains a crucial bottleneck.

item.title: Do Vision-and-Language Transformers Learn Grounded Predicate-Noun Dependencies?
item.description: Recent advances in vision-and-language modeling have seen the development of Transformer architectures that achieve remarkable performance on multimodal reasoning tasks.

item.title: $m^4Adapter$: Multilingual Multi-Domain Adaptation for Machine Translation with a Meta-Adapter
item.description: We consider a very challenging scenario: adapting the MNMT model both to a new domain and to a new language pair at the same time.

item.title: Empathetic Dialogue Generation via Sensitive Emotion Recognition and Sensible Knowledge Selection
item.description: We use a fine-grained encoding strategy which is more sensitive to the emotion dynamics (emotion flow) in the conversations to predict the emotion-intent characteristic of response.

item.title: Local Bayesian optimization via maximizing probability of descent
item.description: Local optimization presents a promising approach to expensive, high-dimensional black-box optimization by sidestepping the need to globally explore the search space.

item.title: Spectral Probing
item.description: Linguistic information is encoded at varying timescales (subwords, phrases, etc.)

item.title: Amos: An Adam-style Optimizer with Adaptive Weight Decay towards Model-Oriented Scale
item.description: We present Amos, a stochastic gradient-based optimizer designed for training deep neural networks.

item.title: Learning Robust Dynamics through Variational Sparse Gating
item.description: Learning world models from their sensory inputs enables agents to plan for actions by imagining their future outcomes.

item.title: Exploration of the Usage of Color Terms by Color-blind Participants in Online Discussion Platforms
item.description: Prominent questions about the role of sensory vs. linguistic input in the way we acquire and use language have been extensively studied in the psycholinguistic literature.

item.title: Context-Enhanced Stereo Transformer
item.description: We construct our stereo depth estimation model, Context Enhanced Stereo Transformer (CSTR), by plugging CEP into the state-of-the-art stereo depth estimation method Stereo Transformer.

item.title: CEFR-Based Sentence Difficulty Annotation and Assessment
item.description: Controllable text simplification is a crucial assistive technique for language learning and teaching.

item.title: Efficiently Tuned Parameters are Task Embeddings
item.description: Thus, we propose to exploit these efficiently tuned parameters as off-the-shelf task embeddings for the efficient selection of source datasets for intermediate-task transfer.

item.title: Multitask Brain Tumor Inpainting with Diffusion Models: A Methodological Report
item.description: Although the majority of inpainting techniques for medical imaging data use generative adversarial networks (GANs), the performance of these algorithms is frequently suboptimal due to their limited output variety, a problem that is already well-known for GANs.

item.title: Triplet Losses-based Matrix Factorization for Robust Recommendations
item.description: Much like other learning-based models, recommender systems can be affected by biases in the training data.

item.title: PaCo: Parameter-Compositional Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning
item.description: However, the gaps between contents and difficulties of different tasks bring us challenges on both which tasks should share the parameters and what parameters should be shared, as well as the optimization challenges due to parameter sharing.

item.title: Structural Kernel Search via Bayesian Optimization and Symbolical Optimal Transport
item.description: Despite recent advances in automated machine learning, model selection is still a complex and computationally intensive process.

item.title: MCSCSet: A Specialist-annotated Dataset for Medical-domain Chinese Spelling Correction
item.description: In this work, we define the task of Medical-domain Chinese Spelling Correction and propose MCSCSet, a large scale specialist-annotated dataset that contains about 200k samples.

item.title: Generative Range Imaging for Learning Scene Priors of 3D LiDAR Data
item.description: We demonstrate the fidelity and diversity of our model in comparison with the point-based and image-based state-of-the-art generative models.

item.title: Turning Fixed to Adaptive: Integrating Post-Evaluation into Simultaneous Machine Translation
item.description: Compared to the fixed policy, the adaptive policy achieves better latency-quality tradeoffs by adopting a flexible translation policy.

item.title: Decoding a Neural Retriever's Latent Space for Query Suggestion
item.description: Neural retrieval models have superseded classic bag-of-words methods such as BM25 as the retrieval framework of choice.

item.title: TransLIST: A Transformer-Based Linguistically Informed Sanskrit Tokenizer
item.description: Existing lexicon driven approaches for SWS make use of Sanskrit Heritage Reader, a lexicon-driven shallow parser, to generate the complete candidate solution space, over which various methods are applied to produce the most valid solution.

item.title: Analyzing and Evaluating Faithfulness in Dialogue Summarization
item.description: The factual correctness of summaries has the highest priority before practical applications.

item.title: SLING: Sino Linguistic Evaluation of Large Language Models
item.description: To understand what kinds of linguistic knowledge are encoded by pretrained Chinese language models (LMs), we introduce the benchmark of Sino LINGuistics (SLING), which consists of 38K minimal sentence pairs in Mandarin Chinese grouped into 9 high-level linguistic phenomena.

item.title: Robustifying Sentiment Classification by Maximally Exploiting Few Counterfactuals
item.description: We demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach in sentiment classification, using IMDb data for training and other sets for OOD tests (i. e., Amazon, SemEval and Yelp).

item.title: Syntax-guided Localized Self-attention by Constituency Syntactic Distance
item.description: Recent works have revealed that Transformers are implicitly learning the syntactic information in its lower layers from data, albeit is highly dependent on the quality and scale of the training data.

item.title: Stochastic Adaptive Activation Function
item.description: The simulation of human neurons and neurotransmission mechanisms has been realized in deep neural networks based on the theoretical implementations of activation functions.

item.title: Multi-View Reasoning: Consistent Contrastive Learning for Math Word Problem
item.description: Math word problem solver requires both precise relation reasoning about quantities in the text and reliable generation for the diverse equation.

item.title: Distilling the Undistillable: Learning from a Nasty Teacher
item.description: The inadvertent stealing of private/sensitive information using Knowledge Distillation (KD) has been getting significant attention recently and has guided subsequent defense efforts considering its critical nature.

item.title: Face Pyramid Vision Transformer
item.description: A novel Face Pyramid Vision Transformer (FPVT) is proposed to learn a discriminative multi-scale facial representations for face recognition and verification.

item.title: Global Counterfactual Explainer for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: One way to address this is counterfactual reasoning where the objective is to change the GNN prediction by minimal changes in the input graph.

item.title: Augmenting Multi-Turn Text-to-SQL Datasets with Self-Play
item.description: We first design a SQL-to-text model conditioned on a sampled goal query, which represents a user's intent, that then converses with a text-to-SQL semantic parser to generate new interactions.

item.title: Twin Contrastive Learning for Online Clustering
item.description: Specifically, we find that when the data is projected into a feature space with a dimensionality of the target cluster number, the rows and columns of its feature matrix correspond to the instance and cluster representation, respectively.

item.title: Diffusion Visual Counterfactual Explanations
item.description: Two modifications to the diffusion process are key for our DVCEs: first, an adaptive parameterization, whose hyperparameters generalize across images and models, together with distance regularization and late start of the diffusion process, allow us to generate images with minimal semantic changes to the original ones but different classification.

item.title: Boosting vision transformers for image retrieval
item.description: (4) We enhance locality of interactions at the deeper layers of the encoder, which is the relative weakness of vision transformers.

item.title: Privacy-Preserved Neural Graph Similarity Learning
item.description: To develop effective and efficient graph similarity learning (GSL) models, a series of data-driven neural algorithms have been proposed in recent years.

item.title: A Non-Asymptotic Moreau Envelope Theory for High-Dimensional Generalized Linear Models
item.description: We prove a new generalization bound that shows for any class of linear predictors in Gaussian space, the Rademacher complexity of the class and the training error under any continuous loss $\ell$ can control the test error under all Moreau envelopes of the loss $\ell$.

item.title: Efficient identification of informative features in simulation-based inference
item.description: To this end, many SBI methods employ a set of summary statistics or scientifically interpretable features to estimate a surrogate likelihood or posterior.

item.title: Equivariant Networks for Zero-Shot Coordination
item.description: Successful coordination in Dec-POMDPs requires agents to adopt robust strategies and interpretable styles of play for their partner.

item.title: A Causal Framework to Quantify the Robustness of Mathematical Reasoning with Language Models
item.description: By grounding the behavioral analysis in a causal graph describing an intuitive reasoning process, we study the behavior of language models in terms of robustness and sensitivity to direct interventions in the input space.

item.title: A Survey of Data Optimization for Problems in Computer Vision Datasets
item.description: Next, we organize these data optimization works according to data problems addressed, and provide a systematic and comparative description.

item.title: CRT-6D: Fast 6D Object Pose Estimation with Cascaded Refinement Transformers
item.description: Learning based 6D object pose estimation methods rely on computing large intermediate pose representations and/or iteratively refining an initial estimation with a slow render-compare pipeline.

item.title: Machine Learning for $K$-adaptability in Two-stage Robust Optimization
item.description: One of the solution approaches to this class of problems is $K$-adaptability.

item.title: Finding Dataset Shortcuts with Grammar Induction
item.description: Many NLP datasets have been found to contain shortcuts: simple decision rules that achieve surprisingly high accuracy.

item.title: On Feature Learning in the Presence of Spurious Correlations
item.description: Deep classifiers are known to rely on spurious features $\unicode{x2013}$ patterns which are correlated with the target on the training data but not inherently relevant to the learning problem, such as the image backgrounds when classifying the foregrounds.

item.title: HesScale: Scalable Computation of Hessian Diagonals
item.description: Second-order optimization uses curvature information about the objective function, which can help in faster convergence.

item.title: Large-batch Optimization for Dense Visual Predictions
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose a simple yet effective algorithm, named Adaptive Gradient Variance Modulator (AGVM), which can train dense visual predictors with very large batch size, enabling several benefits more appealing than prior arts.

item.title: YOWO-Plus: An Incremental Improvement
item.description: On the AVA, our optimized YOWO achieves 20. 6\% frame mAP with 16 frames, also exceeding the official YOWO.

item.title: ConfMix: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation for Object Detection via Confidence-based Mixing
item.description: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation (UDA) for object detection aims to adapt a model trained on a source domain to detect instances from a new target domain for which annotations are not available.

item.title: Rethinking Learning Approaches for Long-Term Action Anticipation
item.description: Action anticipation involves predicting future actions having observed the initial portion of a video.
